definition: to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: General Bradley wouldn't send for you unless he had something in mind.
sentences.chinese: 除非他心里有数，否则布拉德利将军不会召您来的。

sentences.english: Madame Magloire did not say this, but she knew it.
sentences.chinese: 马格洛大娘没有那样说，但是她心里有数。

sentences.english: Such, the know exactly about sth in the heart is accomplished when taking an exam truly.
sentences.chinese: 这样，在真正考试的时候做到心里有数。

sentences.english: But if you have substance, don't worry.
sentences.chinese: 但如果你心里有数的话就不用担心了。

definition: to do as one sees fit/to play it by ear (according to the circumstances)
to plan in advance (idiom)/a card up one's sleeve/forewarned is forearmed
solely engrossed in one thing/just (one thing, no need to worry about the rest)/simply/by all means/please feel free/do not hesitate (to ask for sth)
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
needless to say/it goes without saying
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to make a decision/to make up one's mind
to feel relieved/to feel reassured/to be at ease
